fields.description:
When creating an issue, clicking on the "Epic Link" chooser is apparently trying to return the 100,000+ Epics in our organization.  It takes about 50 seconds to return and the suggestion results are not very good.  Our corporate support staff say there's no way to improve this behavior in the product. 

There should be some strategy(ies) to return more relevant suggestions in a faster fashion (for example most recent Epics related to that project).
fields.summary: Epic link selector slow for large orgs.

fields.description: Currently, I am not able to filter out those user/team members who do not have any assigned task. Please note I am no looking for unassigned issue types, I am willing to filter the users who are not assigned any issue types.
fields.summary: As a Lead/Manager, I must be able to filter the users who is currently not working/assigned any issue type so that i can track and assign some work to all such users

fields.description:
Group (AD, LDAP etc..) information can be viewed from user profile.
 This information is shown to everyone that has _Browse Users_ -permission.

It can be useful to see my own groups, but there should be a possibility to hide this information from others. *This can be a security concern in some companies.*

There should be a global administrator configuration where Jira administrator can decide wether group information is shown in user profiles and to whom it is visible.
fields.summary: Ability to customize group visibility in user profile

fields.description:

 !Screenshot 2020-03-16 21.07.55.png|width=357,height=25!

fields.description:
Hi,

 
 * As we are using LDAP directories for our users we can not use nested group in our configuration

Please find below our context and need (easier to have all the informations in the ticket) :

 

So in our instance we have several usecases :
 * Scrum Team

 * SAFe programs
....

We have a portal to create users for JIra/Confluence and several tools of a Devops toolchain. In order to manage the user we centralize the user management by this portal. We set three roles in JIRA. These are associated with JIra Groups.

By exemple in the projet DVSTEST. The user are managed like this :

 

Rôle : project-administrator
Group : <nameOfProject>-admin

Rôle : project-user
Group : <nameOfProject>-user

Rôle : project-reader
Group : <nameOfProject>-reader

In our SAFe organizations we have lots of users, lots of groups and lots of projects that have to interact with each other

So my need would be to create a "super-group" for a SAFe organization and to have the possibility to add in this group Jira native Group (which are managed with our portal).
It would be usefull to give to all the Jira project Group reading rights.

Ex : Super Group : SAFe_Marketing_reader
In the delegated group : Put all the projects group that would be like to have the reader rights.

Then add the SAFe_reader super group in all the SAFe projects.

That would be a benefit of complexity and of time for us.

I think I would not be the only one who would be interested by this feature (especially SAFe organizations)

Thanks in advance for your consideration.
Please feel free to ask me more question if it is not clear.

 

 

Thanks for your interest.

Regards,

 

Antoine
fields.summary: Ability to have nested group with LDAP directory

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, there is no other way to move the desired field to the sidebar
h3. Suggested Resolution

It is good to have a feature that admin can arrange the desired fields to sidebar
fields.summary: The possibility to move the desired fields to the sidebar

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using any sort of assistive technologies that generate announcements when scrolling through options (should as VoiceOver on Mac OS) on a drop-down menu, such as projects and issue types in the Quick Create menu, the options will not be read as expected.

*This prevents (or at least makes it very hard) creating issues by visually impaired people*, as they can't reliably change issue types, projects, priorities, etc.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable Voice Over (or any other assistive technologies that provide announcements).
 # Click *Create* to create a new issue.
 # Tab to the *Projects* or *Issue Types* drop-down menu.
 # Use the up and down keys on the keyboard to cycle through the options on the menu.

h3. Expected Results

Every option will be read out by the voice-over assistant.
h3. Actual Results

Options are not read when you cycle through them.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Field drop down options are not read by voice assistants

fields.description:
{panel:title=Solution|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
This problem is caused by a bug in the Java runtime: _JDK-8214418 HttpClient falls in running with 100% cpu usage after an error signalled on channel_ (Backported as [JDK-8241054|https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8241054])

The fix has been verified to be available in AdoptOpenJDK 11.0.8 - [https://github.com/AdoptOpenJDK/openjdk-jdk11u/commit/8d1b63a4db2c6348a97b3cf45bd4d2caa7cad6b5]
{panel}

h3. Issue Summary

Similar to BSERV-12131, the HTTP Client will stop working on occasion whenever using Java 11.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure Jira to run on Java 11
 # Register and configure a webhook to the application.
 # Execute the webhook.

h3. Expected Results

The webhook will trigger successfully.
h3. Actual Results

When using Java 11, webhooks will work briefly and eventually fail. Thread dumps will show these webhook publishers in a *BLOCKED* or *WAITING* state:
{code:java}
"Web-Hook-Publisher-0" daemon prio=5 tid=0x0000000000000127 nid=0 waiting on condition 
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
  at java.base/jdk.internal.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
  - parking to wait for <0x00000000a4586577> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock$NonfairSync)
   owned by Web-Hook-Publisher-1 id=0x000000000000012f
  at java.base/java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(Unknown Source)
  at java.base/java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.parkAndCheckInterrupt(Unknown Source)
  at java.base/java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.acquireQueued(Unknown Source)
  at java.base/java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.acquire(Unknown Source)
  at java.base/java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock.lock(Unknown Source)
  at org.apache.http.nio.pool.AbstractNIOConnPool.lease(AbstractNIOConnPool.java:278)
  at org.apache.http.impl.nio.conn.PoolingNHttpClientConnectionManager.requestConnection(PoolingNHttpClientConnectionManager.java:295)
  at org.apache.http.impl.nio.client.AbstractClientExchangeHandler.requestConnection(AbstractClientExchangeHandler.java:377)
  at org.apache.http.impl.nio.client.DefaultClientExchangeHandlerImpl.start(DefaultClientExchangeHandlerImpl.java:129)
  at org.apache.http.impl.nio.client.InternalHttpAsyncClient.execute(InternalHttpAsyncClient.java:141)
  at com.atlassian.httpclient.apache.httpcomponents.BoundedHttpAsyncClient.execute(BoundedHttpAsyncClient.java:49)
  at org.apache.http.impl.client.cache.CachingHttpAsyncClient.callBackend(CachingHttpAsyncClient.java:691)
  at org.apache.http.impl.client.cache.CachingHttpAsyncClient.execute(CachingHttpAsyncClient.java:323)
  at org.apache.http.impl.client.cache.CachingHttpAsyncClient.execute(CachingHttpAsyncClient.java:281)
  at com.atlassian.httpclient.apache.httpcomponents.SettableFuturePromiseHttpPromiseAsyncClient.execute(SettableFuturePromiseHttpPromiseAsyncClient.java:34)
  at com.atlassian.httpclient.apache.httpcomponents.ApacheAsyncHttpClient.doExecute(ApacheAsyncHttpClient.java:339)
  at com.atlassian.httpclient.apache.httpcomponents.ApacheAsyncHttpClient.execute(ApacheAsyncHttpClient.java:292)
  at com.atlassian.httpclient.apache.httpcomponents.DefaultRequest$DefaultRequestBuilder.execute(DefaultRequest.java:258)
  at com.atlassian.httpclient.apache.httpcomponents.DefaultRequest$DefaultRequestBuilder.post(DefaultRequest.java:226)
  at com.atlassian.webhooks.plugin.PublishTaskFactoryImpl$PublishTaskImpl.run(PublishTaskFactoryImpl.java:119)
  at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(Unknown Source)
  at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(Unknown Source)
  at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
{code}
This issue is suspected to be caused by the following JDK bug:
 * JDK-8214418 HttpClient falls in running with 100% cpu usage after an error signalled on channel
 ** [https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8214418] is not public
 ** PR for the fix can be found here: [https://hg.openjdk.java.net/jdk/jdk13/rev/5022a4915fe9]

h3. Solution

Upgrade AdoptOpenJDK to version 11.0.8 which has this issue solved.
h3. Workaround
 # Run Jira Server using Java 8 or;
 # The issue is observed with Java 11 that uses TLS v1.3. TLS v1.2 is unaffected by this. It's possible to force Java 11 to use TLS v1.2 by adding the following JVM parameter: {{-Dhttps.protocols=TLSv1.2}} to your startup properties.
fields.summary: Webhooks intermittently stop working with Java 11

fields.description:
I debugged the Workflow Status IC and found there's no logging except for exceptions. Our Jira is very large and it takes about 4 hours to complete the 1 check box.

Our VPN logs us out after ~20 minutes. If we log back in and navigate to the IC result page, it kicks off another IC scan, so if we're not careful, we'll have 2 scans running.

Since we are not logged in and watching the screen, we don't see the UI come back, and there's no indication the check completed without errors. It would be nice to see in the log that the IC completed passing or failing in the logs.
fields.summary: When an integrity check finishes with no errors, there's no indication in the log the check completed

Today I can only add a worklog.
fields.summary: Delete Worklog with Automation for JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition

The documentation about CSV import ([Creating issues using the CSV importer|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver0713/creating-issues-using-the-csv-importer-964984721.html]) mentions this:
* If you have the Create Issue project permission and the Bulk Change global permission for the relevant projects, you can create issues in bulk using a comma-separated value (CSV) file but it does not mention anything about the Jira Admin permission.
This causes confusion to our customers

h3. Suggestion

The Paragraph should be modified as other document mentioned Jira Admin permission can perform CSV import and a Feature request has already added to provide support for other users like [Project Administrator|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-66962].
fields.summary: Improve the documentation about the CSV import

fields.description:
Representatives of Likn4 TU SA as potential users of the Portfolio For JIRA system have identified use cases that we do not know if it can be handled in the system.

 

We've created two new hierarchy levels above Epic: Initiative and ‘Strategic lever’ (the last one is the highest level)

 

Request 1 (Parent link directly between the standard issue type and the initiative)

Is it possible to create a parent link directly between an Initiative level task and a Standard Issue Type task?

In our business practice, initiatives often consist of Epics that group tasks and individual tasks. It is not effective to create Epic tasks for individual tasks in order to connect this task to the initiative.

If this is not possible, will the functionality described above be created in the future?

 

Request 2 (Many parent links between one initiative and many strategic levers)

Is it possible to create multiple parent links from one task from the Initiative level to many different tasks at the ‘Strategic lever’ level.

We want to be able to define a strategy in the form of many issues at the highest level of the hierarchy, which constitute 'strategic levers'. We want to be able to align the level of initiatives with the strategy by linking the task from the initiative level with each corresponding task from the level of strategy leverage.

Can this demand be met using Portfolio for JIRA? How?
fields.summary: Portfolio for Jira Parent links and hierarchies

fields.description:
We observed some misleading errors with the Integrity Checker for Filter subscriptions.
h3. Steps to reproduce,
 * With an AD or any LDAP user create a filter subscription
 * Disable the user or AD itself and run the integrity checker for Invalid Filer Subscription. Errors, as attached in the screenshot, are observed. !Screenshot 2020-03-13 at 12.20.11 AM.png!

h3. Observations

When checked in the DB and UI these filters are present and the user has to manually resubscribe to them.
{code:java}
test=# select * from filtersubscription;
  id   | filter_i_d |  username  | groupname | last_run | email_on_empty 
-------+------------+------------+-----------+----------+----------------
 10000 |      10001 | user1      |           |          | false
 10001 |      10002 | user1      |           |          | false
(2 rows)
{code}
h3. Desired Output

There was a feature request, JRASERVER-18919 which was turned down a long time back, but it should be revisited again and the misleading errors need to be handled.

h3.Customer Case for Reference
[GHS-180709|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-180709]
fields.summary: Misleading Errors with Integrity Checker

fields.description:
Starting a project re-index on one node triggers other nodes to start it as well (as mentioned in [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/index-replication-jira-data-center-troubleshooting-966676040.html#IndexReplicationJiraDataCenterTroubleshooting-IndexReplicationonRe-index]). When you cancel project re-index operation on the one node, other nodes will still continue re-indexing.

*Stopping project re-index on one node should stop it on the other ones as well.* It will keep the indexes more consistent and won't create situations in which indexes on some nodes are locked, but they aren't on other nodes.
fields.summary: Cancelling project re-indexing on one node does not cancel it on the other nodes

fields.description:
See attached screenshot

*Request 1*

I've discovered that hovering over the progress field of an epic, displays all hours in the stories/subtasks of that epic (which is very handy).

It'd be great if this progress bar showed this info without having to hover, can you fix this?

*Request 2*

Additionally, while I understand that the *estimate (h)* field needs to be manually populated, it'd be great if a field existed to show total hours of an epic so I can understand epic size at a glance that are far in the future (just as the hover state shows total hours)
fields.summary: Progress field in portfolio blank unless you hover

fields.description:
# On the activity stream gadget timestamp for the activity is not shown, instead it shows as for example 30 minutes ago. If we hover over with the mouse on the area it will show the actual timestamp but it's not much user friendly way. Jira Admins should have ability to configure the gadget to show the date/time values using standard format used by look and feel settings.
 # On the service desk project SLA dates are always shown within days,hours, weeks etc. It can be helpful if we have project specific settings to show the actual date/time values in standard dd/mm/yyyy HH:mm or mm/dd/yyyy HH:mm format. Not all project owners find the default format for showing SLA dates useful and may prefer configuring it differently for their project.

As far as i researched we can force Jira to use a specific date/time format globally  by updating the config file on the server but this becomes global and will even affect the project which don't want to use this format. So it makes sense to give ability to configure specific date time format per project or Gadget.
fields.summary: Need ability to configure date time Format per project and at other places such as Gadgets.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As per the documentation - [Configuring file attachments|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver0712/configuring-file-attachments-959314260.html], users are allowed to configure the thumbnail size. However, changing the thumbnail width and height to anything bigger than 200x200px does not reflect on the UI. Note that, the thumbnail(s) under {{$JIRA_HOME/data/attachments/<project-key>/10000/<issue-key>/thumbs}} are generated with the correct dimensions.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open {{$JIRA_HOME/jira-config.properties}}
 # Edit (or add) the values of the following properties with values greater than 200
 {code:none}
jira.thumbnail.maxwidth = 300
jira.thumbnail.maxheight = 300{code}
 # Delete all existing thumbnail images within the attachments directory (that is, those containing '_thumb_' in the filename)
 # Restart Jira

h3. Expected Results

Thumbnails in Issue are resized accordingly to the new {{maxwidth}} and {{maxheight}} values.
h3. Actual Results

No changes observerd to the thumbnail size in the issues.
fields.summary: Thumbnail size in Jira cannot be bigger than 200x200px

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Value changes when typing a large number in a custom field type "Number Field", using other languages than English. The actual number should be 7,5995612126860155 but instead, it shows 7,6

This issue occurs using the *German language* OR *Russian language* on Jira. As indexing language and/or default user language and/or default Jira language.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Switch Jira to German OR Russian language as mentioned above. 
 # Switch your keyboard to match that language.
 # Add a custom field "Number Field" type.
 # Create an issue in Jira and fill up the custom field created earlier with a huge number E.g "7,5995612126860155" (using your keyboard, please *don't* copy-paste this number) then click on "Create" 
 # Head to your issue.
 # Check the field value.

h3. Expected Results

* The value entered in the custom field "Number Field" type should stay the same "7,5995612126860155"

h3. Actual Results

* The value entered in the custom field "Number Field" type changes to "7,6"
* Files attach below:
**  !Russian.png|thumbnail! 
**  !Ticket.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available.

h3. Note

You cannot add such large number using Jira in the English language.
fields.summary: Value changes when typing a large number in a custom field type "Number Field"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Value changes when exporting data from Jira using CSV export. So when opening the CSV file, the number has changed. The actual number should be 4,5995621216860155 but instead, it shows 45.995.621.216.860.100 OR 4.6.

This issue occurs using the *German language* OR *Russian language* on Jira. As indexing language and/or default user language and/or default Jira language.

* There is inconsistency across export file types.
* There is an inconsistency between system and exported value.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Switch Jira to German OR Russian language as mentioned above. 
 # Switch your keyboard to match that language.
 # Add a custom field "Number Field" type.
 # Create an issue in Jira and fill up the custom field created earlier with a huge number E.g "4,5995621216860155" (using your keyboard, please *don't* copy-paste this number).
 # Add the same number to another field like "Description" and click on "Create" 
 # Head to the Issue Navigator and search for your issue.
 # Export using CSV (All fields)
 # Export as HTML.
 # Check the CSV file.
 # Check the HTML file.

h3. Expected Results

In the CSV file and HTML file, the number stays the same as entered in Jira E.g "4,5995621216860155" in the custom field "Number Field" type.

JIRA should export the value as presented in the system. For example, the german system > exported as the german number.

h3. Actual Results

* In the CSV file, the number in the custom field "Number Field" type changes to "4.59956212168601" and sometimes to 4.6
**  !fields CSV.png|thumbnail! 
**  !Russian fields CSV.png|thumbnail! 
* In the CSV file, the number in the "Description" field stays the same.
* Files attached below:
**  [^German.csv] 
**  [^Russian.csv] 

* In the HTML file, all values stay the same.
* Files attached below:
**  [^Russian.html] 
**  [^German.html] 

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Exporting to CSV numeric custom fields shows the incorrect value (German, Russian)

fields.description:
What is required is to add a condition or validator in Jira which could be used to restrict the "same" value to be entered in a custom field while creating/editing an issue within and across projects in Jira.
h3. Example 1

If you have filled up a custom field with a value of 123, in ticket ABC-2.
 Then another user creates/edits issue ABC-3, then that user enters the same value "123" in the same field, it will detect that there is another issue with the same value "123" of the same field, then stops the issue from being created, throwing one of the options below (which can be set by the admin):
 # Not allowing the creation of the ticket and informing the Reporter, that another issue with specific value already exists.
 # Or allows the creation of the issue but it creates a link between both issues automatically.

h3. Example 2

If you have filled up a custom field with a value of 123, in ticket ABC-2 for ProjectA
 Then another user creates/edits issue ABC-3 for ProjectB, then that user enters the same value "123" in the same field, it will detect that there is another issue with the same value "123" of the same field in ProjectA, then stops the issue from being created, throwing one of the options below (which can be set by the admin):
 # Not allowing the creation of the ticket and informing the Reporter, that another issue with a specific value already exists.
fields.summary: Add a Condition or Validator to check the value of a custom field

fields.description:
Jira is a great tool.  As the consumption of Jira getting increased,  more aggregated report requirements are popping up.   Simple queries like  " Aggregated report  on story points of all deliverables in a project" ,   Reports on Kanban teams, combination of Scrum and Kanban (at the release level)  etc., will be helpful.

Thanks,

R
fields.summary: Enable more aggregations

fields.description:
h3. Problem
When using the Sprint Health Gadget, users can click on the progress bar and choose to "View in Issue Navigator".  If the Sprint has any statuses that contain "&", this will result in a truncated JQL query and be invalid.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On a scrum board, add a new status with "&".  For example: "Test & Approve"
# Add the new status to a column, like "In Progress"
# On a dashboard, add the Sprint Health Gadget, referencing the Agile board we configured above.
# On the progress bar, click on the yellow "In Progress" section
# Choose to "View in Issue Navigator"

h3. Expected Results
The resulting filter is correct and returns the issues that are part of the sprint

h3. Actual Results
JQL error is thrown showing:
{code}
Error in the JQL Query: The quoted string 'Test ' has not been completed. (line 1, character 333)
{code}

The JQL is also truncated right after the word "Test", losing the "& Approve" portion.

h3. Workaround
* Rename statuses and remove the "&"
fields.summary: Special Character in Status Names can cause Invalid JQL Filters from Sprint Health Gadget

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When the Sprint Health Gadget reports on an Agile board and Sprint, it will consider all statuses, included any existing unmapped statuses.  This results in an complicating the search filter and may mislead users.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a board with unmapped statuses
** Create 2 projects that have different workflow statuses. ProjectA and ProjectB
** Create a new board for ProjectA, which will contain issues from ProjectA and statuses from ProjectA
** Modify this board's filter to only include ProjectB.  Refresh the configuration page and check columns
** We'll see that statuses that existed from ProjectA are not marked as unmapped
 # On a dashboard, add the Sprint Health Gadget
** Configure this to use the new board and sprint
# Next click on the "Sprint Progress Bar" and choose to "View in Issue Navigator"

h3. Expected Results
The resulting filter will only show relevant statuses that are used by the Sprint/Board

h3. Actual Results
The resulting filter will list out all statuses, including the unmapped ones.

h3. Workaround
Go into each board that the Sprint is part of and ensure that unmapped statuses are removed
fields.summary: Sprint Health Gadget Uses Unmapped Statuses in Search

fields.description:
This was reported by a user of our Jira server today, they reported that they lost work on a detailed comment they were writing in one of these dialogs.

When the escape key is pressed or page navigation is attempted in the Edit or Comment dialogs a popup prevents the user from closing or navigating and losing their work accidentally.

Previously this was made consistent for other dialogs in JRASERVER-41814 however this prompt does not pop up for the Assign, Link, and Log Work actions and work is immediately lost when pressing the escape key.

This also does not happen for custom workflow screens that include the comment field.

Can this be made consistent with the Edit and inline comment dialogs and prompt before closing if a form has been partially filled out?
fields.summary: Make ESCAPE key behavior consistent with Edit dialog for Assign, Link & Log Work, & Custom Workflow dialogs

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Running the utility *{{<JIRA_INSTALL>/bin/config.sh -c}}* in text mode will cause it to not ask for a schema name when selecting SQL Server. This will cause the file {{dbconfig.xml}} to be set without a schema, which is required in SQL Server.

Other issues might arise from this situation, for example, failed upgrade tasks in Jira Service Desk.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Jira.
# Run *{{<JIRA_INSTALL>/bin/config.sh -c}}*
# Select the following options:
** *[D] Database Selection*
** *[S] SQL Server (MS-SQL)*
# Enter the database details such as hostname, port, etc.

h3. Expected Results
The utility will ask for the schema name and write this value accordingly on *{{<JIRA_LOCAL_HOME>/dbconfig.xml}}.*

h3. Actual Results
Schema name is not requested, and the value {{<schema-name>}} won't be written to *{{<JIRA_LOCAL_HOME>/dbconfig.xml}}:*
{code:xml}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<jira-database-config>
  <name>defaultDS</name>
  <delegator-name>default</delegator-name>
  <database-type>mssql</database-type>
  <jdbc-datasource>
    <url>jdbc:sqlserver://;serverName=localhost;portNumber=3341;databaseName=jiradb</url>
    <driver-class>com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerDriver</driver-class>
    <username>atlassian</username>
    <password>atlassian</password>
    <pool-min-size>20</pool-min-size>
    <pool-max-size>20</pool-max-size>
    <pool-max-wait>30000</pool-max-wait>
    <validation-query>select 1</validation-query>
    <min-evictable-idle-time-millis>60000</min-evictable-idle-time-millis>
    <time-between-eviction-runs-millis>300000</time-between-eviction-runs-millis>

<delegator-name>default</delegator-name>
<database-type>mssql</database-type>
<schema-name>jiraschema</schema-name>

  <url>jdbc:sqlserver://dbserver:1433;databaseName=jiradb</url>
  <driver-class>com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerDriver</driver-class>
  <username>jiradbuser</username>
  <password>password</password>
  <pool-min-size>20</pool-min-size>
  <pool-max-size>20</pool-max-size>
  <pool-max-wait>30000</pool-max-wait>
  <pool-max-idle>20</pool-max-idle>
  <pool-remove-abandoned>true</pool-remove-abandoned>
  <pool-remove-abandoned-timeout>300</pool-remove-abandoned-timeout>
 
  <validation-query>select 1</validation-query>
  <min-evictable-idle-time-millis>60000</min-evictable-idle-time-millis>
  <time-between-eviction-runs-millis>300000</time-between-eviction-runs-millis>

  <pool-test-while-idle>true</pool-test-while-idle>
  <pool-test-on-borrow>false</pool-test-on-borrow>
</jdbc-datasource>
</jira-database-config>
{code}
(i) More information about connecting Jira to supported databases is available at the KB article [Connecting Jira applications to a database|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/connecting-jira-applications-to-a-database-938846850.html].
fields.summary: Configuration tool (config.sh) running on text mode doesn't specify a schema for SQL Server

fields.description:
When opening an attachment with an unknown extension, Jira will download the file instead of opening it in the browser. It's possible to add the unknown extension on the mime.types file, but this is not feasible when the extension is inconsistent, i.e. a random string of numbers as the extension. In such cases it's not possible to predict the extension of the file to add to the mime.types file.

It would be helpful to be able to use a wildcard character in the mime.types file. This way, it would be possible to set the MIME type of any extension type.
fields.summary: Allow the MIME type to be set for files without a consistent extension

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When batched emails are turned on, the logs file {{atlassian-jira-outgoing-mail.log}} does not capture or log any entries to troubleshoot and investigate issues even it's enabled to DEBUG.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 - Run Jira instance with batched notifications turned on,
 - Enable _Outgoing mail log_ in the _Logging and profiling_ screen,
 - Trigger events that result in emails being sent, e.g. user mentions.

Observe that no entries are appended to the {{atlassian-jira-outgoing-mail.log}}.
h3. Expected Results
 - Customer expects if there is an issue with outgoing email function it should write in the outgoing mail log (at least if it enabled to DEBUG)
 - They also expect to have an admin console (*UI*) for Mails to monitor its flow and enquire past mails history with data (Advanced than Mail queue)

h3. Actual Results
 - We do not have any way to troubleshoot the outgoing mail issues in the current design as it is not writing anything even if it's enabled to DEBUG.

h3. Workaround
 - You can try using [Notification helper|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver080/configuring-email-notifications-967897768.html#Configuringemailnotifications-troubleshooting] to troubleshoot configuration issues (if only some emails are not being sent)
 - Enable debug logging for the _com.atlassian.jira.plugins.inform_ package and look into the _atlassian-jira.log_ file
fields.summary: Batch email notifications do not log anything to Outgoing Mail log

fields.description: Currently, we are not able to upgrade JIRA patches/bugfix directly via UI. It would be even better if we could upgrade or apply the patch without manually installing it, something similar to JIRA Software/Service Desk upgrades via the Application page. It would be great if this could be implemented in JIRA Data Center and Enterprise Release
fields.summary: JIRA Enterprise Release Zero Down Time Upgrade/UI Direct Upgrade Patches

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using VoiceOver while logged into Jira in Safari does not allow you to access the *Create Issue* dialog.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On macOS 10.15.3 and Safari 13.0.5 (15608.5.11), enable VoiceOver via CMD-F5, and access Jira in Safari.
# Use the C (keyboard shortcut) to create new issue
# Tab to the different fields in Create new issue.

h3. Expected Results

Spoken feedback to allow access to the Create Issue dialog.

h3. Actual Results

Silence in VoiceOver + Safari.

h3. Workaround

The issue is not reproducible using VoiceOver + Chrome or using NVDA + Firefox. The issue is isolated to Safari alone.
fields.summary: Accessibility: Create Issue dialog does not work in Safari when using VoiceOver

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Wrong message display even when component is not selected while raising a ticket in Jira.

*Environment*
 Tested in JIRA 8.7.1, but also reported by a customer using JIRA 7.11.2
h3. Steps to Reproduce

In Jira:-
 # Create an issue
 # Type in issue summary
 # Type a component name and then remove it
 # Provide issue description
 # Click on Create

h3. Expected Results

Issue XYZ-123 - New issue has been successfully created.
h3. Actual Results

A new issue is created, and a new component is added to the project even though the component was removed during the issue creation.

*The following message can be seen in the UI:*
{noformat}
The following message can be seen in the UI:XYZ-123 - New issue has been successfully created.
 You also added a new component to this project. You can assign a component lead for this component in project admin.
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Do not enter component if you don't need it.
fields.summary: Wrong message display even when component is not selected while raising a ticket in Jira.

fields.description:
We would like to have the ability to customize the notifications, to display the email of the user who triggered the action, instead of the default *From address* value configured in the SMTP server.

If someone mentions any users currently you receive a notification similar to :

FW:[Jira] User1 mentioned you on TP-1
From: User1 (Jira) <donotreply@atlassian.com>

We would like to configure a notification as it follows:

FW:[Jira] User1 mentioned you on TP-1
From: User1 (Jira) <user1@atlassian.com>
fields.summary: As a Jira Admin, I would like to customize mail notifications by replacing the default sender by the email of the user who triggered the action.

fields.description:
h3.  
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 22 September 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

After reviewing the overall customer interest and impact of this bug report we have decided to close this issue down. Our analysis has shown that over time this issue hasn't collected a significant number of votes, watchers, comments, or support cases from customers and therefore has remained very low on our priority list. Given these findings we can conclude it will not be fixed in the foreseeable future and wish to be transparent about our priorities by closing it as *Timed Out*.

We understand that hearing a decision like this can be disappointing, but we hope you'll appreciate our transparent approach to product priorities and communications. We will continue to watch this issue for further updates, so please feel free to share any thoughts in the comments.

Thank you,

Mateusz Ostaszewski,

Software Engineer in Jira Server
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

In case that "Update group memberships when logging in" is set while "Nested Group" is enabled, the user will somehow be lost its nested membership after log in.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Integrate JIRA with AD using "Nested Groups"
 # Create 3 Levels of group membership in AD such as:
{code:java}
Parent > First > Seconds > Member1, Member2{code}

 # Sync the directory in JIRA and confirm that the users have "First" and "Parents" groups.
 # Rename one of the Group level e.g. "First" to "One"
 # Sync the directory in JIRA and the user should have "One" as an additional group.
 # Let one of the users log in.

h3. Expected Results

None of the membership will be lost
h3. Actual Results

The user will only have the direct group membership (Seconds) and lost the nested groups
h3. Workaround

Setting the "Update group memberships when logging in" to "Never" appears to not cause the user to lose the membership.

The following can be found when the user somehow lost the memberships
{code:java}
2020-02-25 17:57:10,970+0800 http-nio-8861-exec-3 DEBUG anonymous 1077x276x1 1yw98av 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/gadget/1.0/login [c.a.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory] Updating groups on login for user apache4
{code}
fields.summary: Nested Groups Membership Missing when "Update group memberships when logging in" used

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
As logged in user I have my avatar displayed on Jira top navigation panel (right hand corner). When Gravatar is enabled (by default) it changes to the avatar of another user when you view his/her user profile in Jira. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Check that _Allow Gravatars_ is set to ON (see [Configuring JIRA application options|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver072/configuring-jira-application-options-828788218.html]) 
# Click on a user mention to visit their profile in Jira
# Look at the avatar displayed on the Jira blue navigation panel (top right hand corner). 

h3. Expected Results

Jira should display current user avatar.
h3. Actual Results

Instead of displaying current use avatar, Jira displays the avatar of the user whose profile you visit.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Accessing other user profile changes current user profile avatar in Jira navigation panel

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Users may wrongly expect the Confluence page link to behave like a web link when linking Confluence pages to issues. E.g. they may expect to be able to link to an anchor section in the page content like https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver/linking-issues-939937913.html#Linkingissues-CreatingalinktoaConfluencepage.
* In the scenario described above, Jira disregards the anchor reference in the URL when creating the Confluence page link.
* Workaround for that scenario should be to link to the Confluence page content using Web link instead. Same applies to linking to a comment on another Jira instance.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a note to documentation addressing this expectation and clarifying how page URL behaves differently from web URL when linking Confluence pages.
fields.summary: Add a note to Issue Linking documentation to clarify how Confluence page link might behave differently than a web link

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Mail handlers will process messages in a loop if the following conditions are met:
* The mail handler has been configured to forward errors to a mailbox through the *Forward* field on its configuration.
* The e-mail has an attachment that is larger than the maximum size allowed by the instance (10 MB by default).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a mail server connection and Mail Handler.
# Configure an SMTP server in the *Outgoing Mail* section of Jira.
# When configuring the Mail Handler, enter an e-mail address on the *Forward* field.
# Send an e-mail to the mailbox used by this Mail Handler, ensuring that it has a file attached to it that surpasses the maximum attachment size configured in Jira.

h3. Expected Results
The Mail Handler will process the message, the file will not be attached to the corresponding issue, and then the Mail Handler will proceed to the next message.

h3. Actual Results
The Mail Handler will read the attached file until its size is larger than the maximum allowed - once this happens, an error will be thrown indicating that the file will not be attached to the issue, which will be forwarded to the e-mail address configured in the mail handler. Once this happens, the Mail Handler will try to process the same attachment again, entering a loop.

{code}
2020-03-06 16:42:20,170 DEBUG [Incoming] Caesium-2-3 anonymous    Inc * 1 FETCH (BODY[2]<15220736> {9868}
2020-03-06 16:42:20,170 DEBUG [Incoming] Caesium-2-3 anonymous    Inc JvM1UwVWJBTVZUREhsdHNoRnNM
...
2020-03-06 16:42:20,187 ERROR [Incoming] Caesium-2-3 anonymous    Inc Inc[10000]: test.log is too large to attach. Attachment is 10.61 MB but the largest allowed attachment is 10.00 MB.
2020-03-06 16:42:20,187 DEBUG [Incoming] Caesium-2-3 anonymous    Inc Encountered an error creating the attachment atlassian-jira-incoming-mail.log for issue TES-4
2020-03-06 16:42:20,189 DEBUG [Incoming] Caesium-2-3 anonymous    Inc Forwarding error message to 'test@example.com'
2020-03-06 16:42:20,297 DEBUG [Incoming] Caesium-2-3 anonymous    Inc Sending mail to [test@example.com]
2020-03-06 16:42:23,158 DEBUG [Incoming] Caesium-2-3 anonymous    Inc A956 FETCH 1 (BODY[]<0.16384>)
...
2020-03-06 16:42:23,925 DEBUG [Incoming] Caesium-2-3 anonymous    Inc A957 FETCH 1 (BODY[]<16384.16384>)
2020-03-06 16:42:24,198 DEBUG [Incoming] Caesium-2-3 anonymous    Inc * 1 FETCH (BODY[]<16384> {16384}
2020-03-06 16:42:24,198 DEBUG [Incoming] Caesium-2-3 anonymous    Inc FJZWCtLL29kaGgxeDZvZmlESGNzMWVL
{code}

(!) One thing to note is that this will only be replicated if Jira is configured with a valid outgoing mail server.

h3. Workaround

Disable forwarding error messages to a mailbox by removing the value from the *Forward* field in the Mail Handler configuration.
fields.summary: Mail Handler might go into a loop when processing messages

fields.description:
From Jira 8.7, there is a new feature to anonymize users:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/anonymizing-users-992677655.html

However, there is some limitations where the anonimization can only be implemented for Internal Directory users.

We suggest to implement a feature where LDAP users (Connector or Delegated) could also be anonymized to comply with GDPR requirements.
fields.summary: Anonymize LDAP users

fields.description:
h3. Description
Since Jira 8.4 and forward, there were a few changes to the AUI as per [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracore/preparing-for-jira-8-4-975040967.html]. This caused a few issues, for example, the "Add users to a role" dropdown now is missing the email from the accounts listed, which can cause issues if you have accounts with the same or similar names, but different emails to differentiate them. 

The previous AUI showed emails.

h3. How to reproduce
Go to *Project Settings > User and Roles > Add a user to a role* and try to list users with similar names.

h3. Expected results
The list of accounts should include the accounts's emails along with the username.

h3. Actual results
The list of accounts only shows the name of the account

h3. Tests
- It was tested in Jira 7.12.1 the behaviour which included the email as per attachment.
- It was tested in Jira 8.7.1 the behaviour, which didn't include the email as per attachment.
fields.summary: Add a user to a Role dropdown should include the accounts's email

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Node becomes a stale node during starting it up when you perform REST API call. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Start first Jira node - node_id = node1
 # Start second Jira node - node_id = node2
 # During starting up the second node, perform REST API against first node e.g.

{code:java}
http://localhost:8090/jira/rest/api/2/cluster/node/node2/offline{code}

h3. Expected Results
REST API returns the error and Node state will not change

h3. Actual Results
Node state becomes _OFFLINE_

h3. Workaround
Restart affected node
fields.summary: Node can be moved to OFFLINE state by REST API if node is starting up

fields.description:
h2. The Problem

Not all workflows start with an issue. And not all issues have just one branch addressing them. Finally, not all branches address only one issue. However, the only way to correctly connect an issue and a branch is by creating a new branch from an issue. Meanwhile, this often not how issues are addressed.
h2. Suggested Solution

Add a way to connect any existing issue with any existing branch in any connected VCS, regardless of creation order or name.
h2. Remarks
fields.summary: Ability to Link an Existing Issue to Any Existing Branch

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Export a workflow from Jira cloud
 # Import the .jwb workflow file in Jira server

h3. Expected Results

h3. Actual Results

The below error is thrown in the GUI

!image-2020-03-06-11-51-16-842.png|width=539,height=183!

The only way is to do a full import process. for detailed steps,  please refer to [Restoring a project from JIRA Cloud to JIRA Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver075/restoring-a-project-from-backup-935391688.html#Restoringaprojectfrombackup-ondemandmigrationRestoringaprojectfromJIRACloudtoJIRAServer]
fields.summary: Ability to Import single project/workflow from Jira Cloud to Jira Server

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As a Jira administrator, I would like to use the following format for jira.date.picker.*java*.format and jira.date.time.picker.*java*.format:
yyyy/MM/dd HH:mm:ss.SSS

But there does not seem to be a corresponding format for jira.date.picker.*javascript*.format and jira.date.time.picker.*javascript*.format

This will then cause errors when trying to use the date/time picker in the UI. According the Atlassian article below, the format should be using [https://www.adminschoice.com/unix-date-format-examples], but this format does not work:
%Y/%m/%d %H:%M:%S.%N
was hoping to do something like this:
%Y/%m/%d %H:%M:%S.%3N
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set the Java value to yyyy/MM/dd HH:mm:ss.SSS
 # Set the Javascript value to %Y/%m/%d %H:%M:%S.%N or %Y/%m/%d %H:%M:%S.%3N

h3. Expected Results

The date/time picker values will match and will be able to use all available options down to nanoseconds. 
h3. Actual Results

The values give an error and do not work. 
h3. Workaround

Workaround discovered:  use this format to achieve nanoseconds:

%Y/%m/%d %H:%M:%S.%S

*Links*

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/changing-the-due-date-input-format-192536.html]

In this article it states:
{quote} * For Java formats, specify date/time formats based on the [Java SimpleDateFormat|http://download.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/text/SimpleDateFormat.html].
 * For JavaScript formats, specify date/time formats based on the [Unix date format|https://www.adminschoice.com/unix-date-format-examples].{quote}
[https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/configuring-the-look-and-feel-of-your-jira-applications-938846975.html]
fields.summary: Allow nanoseconds in Date/Time picker

fields.description:
*Richard van der Meel* originally reported this issue as a *bug* back in 2014, JRASERVER-36904, but I couldn't determine if he ever resubmitted the issue as a feature request. This particular issue has been causing us problems, forcing us to move an issue from one project to the intended project, but only if someone even noticed that an issue was created in the wrong project.

 

I know that JRASERVER-18199 was marked as *fixed* while JRASERVER-1555 was marked as *won't fix*, which both seem to be related to this particular issue. JRASERVER-18199 seems to be what's causing the issue described here, but that feature seems like it should only take effect if the *Create Another* checkbox is selected. JRASERVER-1555 doesn't seem like the solution because it can be annoying to have to select a project every single time I create a ticket.

 

What seems more intuitive is to just set the *Project* field based on the project for the issue/project that's currently being viewed in the active browser tab instead of setting it based on the last project that was *loaded*.

 

Using the example described in JRASERVER-36904, 

 
 # Open JIRA in 2 tabs
 # Go to the *first tab* and open *Project A*
 # Go the the *second tab* and open *Project B*
 # **Go back to the *first tab* and click *Create*
 # The selected project on the *Create Issue* screen will be *Project B*
 # **Close the *Create Issue* screen
 # Refresh the *first tab* so the screen reloads
 # Click *Create* again
 # Now the selected project on the *Create Issue* screen will show *Project A* selected

 

By setting the *Project* field based on the project that's being viewed in the active tab, this would help prevent a lot of headaches of having to hunt down issues that intended to be created for one project, but accidentally got created in another project. This would be especially helpful for teams who have *a lot* of projects.
fields.summary: As a reporter, I would like the Project to be set based on the current page when creating an issue

fields.description: Currently whenever click on the issue tab users see tickets those ordered by priority. We would like to have a default filter order by created instead of priority from issue screen. Please add the feature to allow us to change the default filters. Thank you

fields.description:
As a user I would like quickly to get an overview with more details of linked issues.
A simple suggestion could be to add an icon next to each Issue Link group, as show in the attached image. (or similar)

When clicking on the icon it will take you to the regular search issue dialog, where it easily can be customised to show the fields you would like to see, or otherwise modify / bulk change this group.

Today I would normally search them our manually using a function like

*issueFunction in linkedIssuesOf("key = JIRAKEY-1", "Split To")*

 

!image-2020-03-05-15-48-52-958.png!
fields.summary: Simple access to search out groups of "Issue Links"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When creating a ticket from a Scrum board based on a JQL filter, Jira auto-populates the field with a new label. Thus populating my environment with a new, duplicate label but with lower case.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
The steps are below, I was able to reproduce it on Jira 8.7.1                                                                                            # Create a label called "Test-Label"
# Create a filter with the below JQL
#* {code:java}
 Project = TestProject AND labels = Test-Label ORDER BY Rank ASC
{code}
# Create a Scrum board with the filter above
# At the bottom of the backlog, click on "+ Create issue", the issue creation screen pops up with a pre-populated label "test-label". 

 
h3. Expected Results
The correct label mentioned in the JQL filter ("Test-Label") should appear when creating an issue from the board.

h3. Actual Results

The issue creation screen pops up with a pre-populated label "test-label". This label does not exist, but if you proceeded to create the issue, it will create the new label. 

Thus populating my environment with a new, duplicate label but with lower case.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Creating a ticket from a Scrum board gets auto populated the label field with a new incorrect value

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Searching for a Confluence page with non-ASCII Characters doesn't work, even when {{useBodyEncodingForURI="true"}} is set {{server.xml}}.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two pages in Confluence with titles test and тест.
# Search from the issue view, More > Link > Confluence Page > search for a page.
# Search a page using any of the problematic characters like тест.

h3. Expected Results
Search works fine.

h3. Actual Results
The error _The Jira server could not be contacted. This may be a temporary glitch or the server may be down_ will be shown.

h3. Workaround
Search using standard ASCII characters instead.
fields.summary: Searching for a Confluence page with non-ASCII Characters doesn't work

fields.description:
As default _maxHttpHeaderSize_ value is _8192_ and cannot be changed, we have to create customised docker image based on [https://bitbucket.org/atlassian-docker/docker-atlassian-jira] to allow the value to be increased to avoid below error

{code:java}
HTTP Status 400 – Bad Request
Type Exception Report

Message Request header is too large

Description The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Exception

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Request header is too large
	org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11InputBuffer.fill(Http11InputBuffer.java:726)
	org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11InputBuffer.parseHeader(Http11InputBuffer.java:873)
	org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11InputBuffer.parseHeaders(Http11InputBuffer.java:579)
	org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Processor.service(Http11Processor.java:700)
	org.apache.coyote.AbstractProcessorLight.process(AbstractProcessorLight.java:66)
	org.apache.coyote.AbstractProtocol$ConnectionHandler.process(AbstractProtocol.java:808)
	org.apache.tomcat.util.net.NioEndpoint$SocketProcessor.doRun(NioEndpoint.java:1498)
	org.apache.tomcat.util.net.SocketProcessorBase.run(SocketProcessorBase.java:49)
	java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(Unknown Source)
	java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(Unknown Source)
	org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.TaskThread$WrappingRunnable.run(TaskThread.java:61)
	java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
Note The full stack trace of the root cause is available in the server logs.

Apache Tomcat/8.5.42
{code}

There was a similar one reported for Confluence docker image at https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-59318
fields.summary: Allow setting maxHttpHeaderSize by environment variable in jira-software docker image

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In IE 11, when you are viewing the Kanban board there is additional white space at the bottom of the board which causes an extra scroll bar to appear inside the board window.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Kanban board
 # Open in IE11

h3. Expected Results

A single scroll bar appears when needed to scroll to additional results on the board.
h3. Actual Results

An additional scroll bar is added which causes unexpected behavior when scrolling both inside and outside this element.

 

!image-2020-03-03-18-06-59-291.png|width=489,height=193!
h3. Workaround

Use an alternative [browser|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver084/supported-platforms-979404246.html].

You can also disable the following:
 * {{overflow-y: scroll;}} on the div {{class="ghx-has-swimlanes ghx-band-2".}}
fields.summary: Double scroll bar on Kanban board in IE11

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you update the issue type to sub-task during a Bulk Update (even single issues), and this issue has an Epic Link, the link will be preserved even though a sub-task should not be allowed to be Epic Linked.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Story and assign it to an Epic >
 # From the issue search screen, search for the project the Story exists in >
 # Perform a 'Bulk Move', select only the Story, and choose the 'Move' option >
 # While moving the issue in this way, the system allows you to choose a new issue type: sub-task, and give the issue a new parent. In this test, I moved the Story to a new Project, and chose another Story there to be the new Parent issue.
 # Once this move was complete, and the Story attached to an Epic became a Sub-task - the Sub-task was shown in the 'Issues in Epic' section of the original Epic.

h3. Expected Results

Sub-Task would not be included as 'Issue in Epic'
h3. Actual Results

Converted Sub-Task shows as 'Issue in Epic'
h3. Workaround

Convert the issue to a issue type like Story, and convert back to a sub-task using a non Bulk Update method.
fields.summary: Converting a Standard Issue Type to a Sub-Task using Bulk Update will cause the Sub-Task to appear in the 'Issues in Epic' section

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Atlassian ships products like Jira Server/Confluence Server with an Apache Tomcat webserver. Out of the box, we don't ship any products I am aware of that use the AJP connector.

However customers could enable this as a means to setup an apache reverse proxy with our products. 
 if they do this, they should be made aware of the recent [CVE-2020-1938: Ghostcat - Apache Tomcat AJP File Read/Inclusion Vulnerability (CNVD-2020-10487) - Blog  Tenable®|https://www.tenable.com/blog/cve-2020-1938-ghostcat-apache-tomcat-ajp-file-readinclusion-vulnerability-cnvd-2020-10487] and [Apache Tomcat® - Apache Tomcat 8 vulnerabilities|https://tomcat.apache.org/security-8.html#Fixed_in_Apache_Tomcat_8.5.51]


h3. Suggested Solution
We should at least update documents such as 
* [Integrating Jira with Apache using SSL - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/integrating-jira-with-apache-using-ssl-938847754.html] 
* [Configuring Apache Reverse Proxy Using the AJP Protocol - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/configuring-apache-reverse-proxy-using-the-ajp-protocol-938847753.html]
* [Integrating Jira applications with IIS - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/integrating-jira-applications-with-iis-938847749.html]

to have some kind of banner/warning about this CVE.  This way we can at least try to prevent users on unpatched versions from making themselves vulnerable to a known attack.


h3. Why this is important
Help keep customers secure.  We should acknowledge these steps could be potentially leaving system vulnerable to an RCE attack.
fields.summary: Documentation on configuring Jira Server with Apache AJP should note recent Ghost Cat CVE-2020-1938

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Modifying the {{jira.bulk.edit.limit.issue.count}} value via the {{jira-config.properties}} file requires a restart of JIra to take effect.
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow users to modify the {{jira.bulk.edit.limit.issue.count}} value via Advanced Settings in the UI without needing to restart Jira.
h3. Workaround 
Modify/create the {{jira.bulk.edit.limit.issue.count}} value via the {{jira-config.properties}} file using the method outlined in [Edit the jira-config.properties file in Jira server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/edit-the-jira-config-properties-file-in-jira-server-317194938.html] and restart Jira.
fields.summary: Modify jira.bulk.edit.limit.issue.count value via UI

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When importing Jira issues via CSV, links are not imported with the following error being shown. 
{code:java}
Unable to link issue from 10112 to MIN-17 with link named 'Blocks': Cannot find imported issue key for external id 'MIN-17'{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a CSV of Jira issues that contain issue links
 # Import the CSV 
 # Jira will fail to import the issue links due to the issue ids being changed.

Example of logging:
{noformat}
# First step is importing the issues 

2020-02-28 16:43:24,372 INFO - Importing: Issues
2020-02-28 16:43:24,372 INFO - ------------------------------
2020-02-28 16:43:24,372 INFO - Only new items will be imported
2020-02-28 16:43:24,388 INFO - Importing issue: [externalId='10116', summary='Instructions for deleting this sample board and project are in the description for this issue >> Click the "MIN-17" link and read the description tab of the detail view for more']
2020-02-28 16:43:24,436 INFO - Custom field not found. Creating a new custom field for com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.external.beans.ExternalCustomField@6598bcf6[id=External issue ID,name=External issue ID,typeKey=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:textfield,searcherKey=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:textsearcher,valueMappingDefinition=<null>,valueSet=<null>]
2020-02-28 16:43:24,684 INFO - Importing issue: [externalId='10112', summary='As a developer, I can update details on an item using the Detail View >> Click the "MIN-13" link at the top of this card to open the detail view']
2020-02-28 16:43:24,751 INFO - Reindexing last 2 issues imported ...
2020-02-28 16:43:24,781 INFO - Reindexing took 27 ms.
2020-02-28 16:43:24,781 INFO - 2 issues successfully created
2020-02-28 16:43:24,781 INFO - ------------------------------
2020-02-28 16:43:24,781 INFO - Finished Importing : Issues
2020-02-28 16:43:24,781 INFO - ------------------------------

# Now the system tries to import the links and fails because the Issue ID was changed
2020-02-28 16:43:24,807 INFO - Importing: Issue Links & Subtasks
2020-02-28 16:43:24,807 INFO - ------------------------------
2020-02-28 16:43:24,807 INFO - Only new items will be imported
2020-02-28 16:43:24,811 ERROR - Unable to link issue from 10112 to MIN-17 with link named 'Blocks': Cannot find imported issue key for external id 'MIN-17'
2020-02-28 16:43:24,811 INFO - ------------------------------
2020-02-28 16:43:24,811 INFO - Finished Importing : Issue Links & Subtasks
2020-02-28 16:43:24,811 INFO - ------------------------------{noformat}

h3. Suggested Solution
During Import the system should be able to decipher that the Issue Keys are changed first and then the issue inks are imported. 

h3. Workaround
When Jira imports issues into an empty project, it retains the numbering scheme of the Issue Key. 
* Thusly, [OLD Project key]-337 becomes [NEW Project KEY]-337. 

* To resolve this, find and replace in the CSV and change {{OLD PROJECT KEY}} to {{NEW PROJECT KEY}} and reimported the CSV. 
* When reimporting Jira knows issues exist and do not need to be recreated/doubled. 
* During the linking, as Jira could now find the Issue Key it could link the issues successfully.
fields.summary: Importing issues via CSV does not create issue links

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When viewing an issue in Jira, there exists an Activity tab you can click on. This shows all kinds of actions in relation to the issue such as comments, issues updates, mentions etc. However at times when there is a lot of data to here, Jira will currently use a 'Read More' link so that it doesn't actually load the entire comment here.

!jraserver-readmorelink.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution

If there was an option in Jira to allow either administrators or end users to prevent this read more link and instead show the entirety of the activity event in relation to that issue, this would be helpful in some use cases.
h3. Why this is important

Promotes more transparency in regards to data and changes within Jira
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: When viewing the activity tab of an issue you should be able to see the entire action, and not have to click a 'Read More' link to see the full comment

fields.description:
Clone of JRASERVER-32548

Lets say you have some *required* custom fields with *context* configured specifically for Project A, and you want to move an issue from Project B to Project A. When you move the issue, JIRA will prompt you to update those required fields through the UI. (This is step 3 of 4)

The order in which the custom fields appear does not match the order of the custom fields that you set up in the Issue Edit Screen.

Example:
1. When I Edit an issue, I am presented with the Edit Issue screen like so: [^EditIssue.jpg]
2. When I attempt to move an issue into this project, of this issue type, the *step 3 of 4* of the Move process will prompt me to key in values for those required fields. The order of the custom fields differs: [^MoveIssue.jpg]

This can cause confusion for some customers who require those fields to be ordered exactly as they were in the Edit Issue screen.
fields.summary: Order fields on bulk move screen according to the order designated on the edit issue screen.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Inefficient SQL query causing long time to fetch deleted worklogs via REST interface. This is present when an instance has bigger amount of deleted worklogs.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure there are many deleted work logs in Jira (hundreds of thousands)
 # Execute the following REST request to fetch deleted worklogs:
{code:java}
curl -v -u <username>:<password> <base_URL>/rest/api/2/worklog/deleted{code}

h3. Expected Results

The request returns results within reasonable amount of time.
h3. Actual Results

The request returns results after some longer period of time (xx minutes up to couple of hours, depending on the size of the instance).

At the same time, the database is processing the query for a long time and it locks one CPU core while doing so.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
h3. Notes
* Reproduced using PostgreSQL database
 * SQL query that gets executed:
{code:java}
select cast(CHANGE_ITEM.oldvalue as int8), max(CHANGE_GROUP.created)
from public.changeitem CHANGE_ITEM
left join public.changegroup CHANGE_GROUP
on CHANGE_ITEM.groupid = CHANGE_GROUP.id
where CHANGE_ITEM.field = 'WorklogId' and (CHANGE_GROUP.created >= '2019-01-01 00:00:00.000000' and CHANGE_GROUP.created <= '2021-01-01 00:00:00.000000') and cast(CHANGE_ITEM.oldvalue as int8) not in (select WORKLOG.id
from public.worklog WORKLOG)
group by cast(CHANGE_ITEM.oldvalue as int8)
order by max(CHANGE_GROUP.created) asc
limit 1000;"
{code}

 * Present with default indexes created (PostgreSQL example):
{code:java}
 tablename  |        indexname        |                                         indexdef
-------------+-------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 changegroup | chggroup_author_created | CREATE INDEX chggroup_author_created ON public.changegroup USING btree (author, created)
 changegroup | chggroup_issue_id       | CREATE INDEX chggroup_issue_id ON public.changegroup USING btree (issueid, id)
 changegroup | pk_changegroup          | CREATE UNIQUE INDEX pk_changegroup ON public.changegroup USING btree (id)
 changeitem  | chgitem_group_field     | CREATE INDEX chgitem_group_field ON public.changeitem USING btree (groupid, field)
 changeitem  | pk_changeitem           | CREATE UNIQUE INDEX pk_changeitem ON public.changeitem USING btree (id){code}
fields.summary: Inefficient SQL query causing long time to fetch deleted worklogs via REST interface

fields.description:
h3. DESCRIPTION

While searching for an issue to link to another issue, search based on keyword, looks for keyword in Project, Title, Description and Comment fields. It doesn't not include other fields / customer fields
h3. STEPS TO REPRODUCE THE ISSUE

1. Create 3 issues (# MCP-23, # MCP-42, # MCP-44)  !Screenshot 2020-02-27 at 8.03.48 PM.png|width=341,height=302!
 2. Add custom field to the issue
 3. Enter the value for custom field (INC-Ticket): SD3425 on first two issues
 4. Add the keyword 'SD3425' in comment field
 5. Navigate to search screen, enter the keyword 'SD3425' in the search window, click search and result shows 3 issues # MCP-23, # MCP-42, # MCP-44  !Screenshot 2020-02-27 at 8.04.32 PM.png|width=283,height=223!
 6. Open issue # MCP-42 --> More --> Link --> search for issue -> enter the keyword 'SD3425'
h3. OBSERVED BEHAVIOUR

1. Here we could see only # MCP-23 issue displayed   !Screenshot 2020-02-27 at 8.05.07 PM.png|width=584,height=461!
h3. EXPECTED BEHAVIOUR

1. Ideally, # MCP-23 and # MCP-44 should be seen in the result  !Screenshot 2020-02-27 at 8.06.25 PM.png|width=366,height=281!
h3. FINDINGS

When 'search for issue' shows below entries in HAR Files -
{code:java}
1. http://JIRA-SERVER/rest/api/2/search?jql=(key%20=%20%22SD3425%22)%20and%20key%20!=%20MCP-42&maxResults=10&_=1582810374475
2. http://JIRA-SERVER/rest/api/2/search?jql=(project%20=%20%22SD3425%22)%20and%20key%20!=%20MCP-42&maxResults=10&_=1582810374476
3. http://JIRA-SERVER/rest/api/2/search?jql=(summary%20~%20%22SD3425%22%20OR%20description%20~%20%22SD3425%22%20OR%20comment%20~%20%22SD3425%22)%20and%20key%20!=%20MCP-42&maxResults=10&_=1582810374477
{code}
Above JQL doesn't shows custom field. Hence, the search doesn't show MCP-44
h3. WORKAROUND

In 'search for issue' select Advance and use JQL given below and it will give the desired result
{code:java}
 text ~ "SD3425"
{code}
  !Screenshot 2020-02-27 at 8.06.25 PM.png|width=421,height=323!
fields.summary: 'Search for an issue' to Link issue doesn't take custom field in search criteria

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Searching German indexed content will not return results when content is in Italic.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set the Indexing language to German.
 # Create one ticket with test123 in the description.
 # Create a second ticket with _test123_ in the description (note description here is in Italic)
 !NormalAndItalicIssues.png|thumbnail! 

 # Under Issues>Search for issues, run a search with the JQL "text~test123"

h3. Expected Results

Both tickets should be returned in the results.
h3. Actual Results

The ticket with the description in Italic will not be returned in the search results.
 !Screen Shot 2020-02-27 at 14.33.09.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround

If possible change indexing language to English.
fields.summary: Missing Search Results When Indexing Language Set to German and Content in Italic
Fixing api return 403 instead of 401 in case users don't have permission

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Starting in Jira 8.6 there's a new Cluster monitoring page available to Jira system administrators gathers real-time data such as node ID, address, uptime (since the last restart), load and memory. The page displays the information for active nodes in your cluster, so whenever a node is down it disappears from the list. 

However, when there are two old Hipchat classes in the {{pluginstate}} table, the Clustering page does not work as expected. There are no errors reported in the backend, but in the frontend, you can see a Javascript error in the browser Developer tools:

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

{code}
Uncaught Error: acm/app/models/node-collection missing ajs
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Jira Data Center 8.6.0 or higher 
 # Add the two classes below to your {{pluginstate}} table
||pluginkey|pluginenabled||
|com.atlassian.plugins.base-hipchat-integration-plugin| false|
|com.atlassian.plugins.base-hipchat-integration-plugin-api|false|
 # Restart Jira
 # Try accessing the Clustering page

h3. Expected Results

The Clustering page works regardless of old Hipchat classes in the database.

h3. Actual Results

The Clustering page breaks when those classes are present, what is common on installations that are being upgraded from old Jira versions.

h3. Workaround

Delete the old classes with the SQL commands below and restart JIRA:

{code}
delete from pluginstate where pluginkey = 'com.atlassian.plugins.base-hipchat-integration-plugin';
delete from pluginstate where pluginkey = 'com.atlassian.plugins.base-hipchat-integration-plugin-api';
delete from pluginstate where pluginkey = 'com.atlassian.labs.hipchat.hipchat-for-jira-plugin';
{code}

 (i) be sure to add the appropriate schema to the table name, if you're using databases such as SQL Server or Oracle.
fields.summary: Blank Clustering page because of old Hipchat classes in the pluginstate table

fields.description:
I would like to be able to find all issues, which are children of Epics meeting certain criteria, e.g. all children issues of Epics in project X (or any other JQL condition.

Something like this:

issue in parent("key = value")

e.g.

issue in parent(project = XY)

Another example would be like:

issue "key" = "value" AND parent ("key" = "value")

e.g.

issue in status = done AND parent (status = in progress)

Currently, this is not possible without a specialized app.

Thanks,
Daniel

The workflow allows us to set a post function to perform one of the following:
- assign to current user
- assign to lead developer
- assign to reporter
- or use update issue field select assignee, and select someone who will always be assigned

 

for our teams purposes, several developers and testers may work an issue, so we created a custom field titled "Developer" and "Tester". it would be best if when i use the last option presented above "update issue field" that i could select Assignee and set the field value from an existing "Custom Field - User Picker (single user)" selection. This would assure as we work through our workflow, we can auto assign as the transition occurs between reporter, project lead review, developer making the fix, tester confirming the fix is adequate, and then closure.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

[Jira Server search syntax for text fields documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/search-syntax-for-text-fields-939938747.html] indicates that users can boost a term in order to make Jira return more relevant search results. Details in [Search syntax for text fields: Boosting a term: ^|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/search-syntax-for-text-fields-939938747.html#Searchsyntaxfortextfields-Boostingaterm:^]

The problem with this section is that this does not appear to be true in the current versions of Jira Server today.  Boosting a term does not at all change the order in which the issues are returned in Jira, nor does it affect the number of issues returned by any JQL query.  Hence it appears to be doing nothing today.  In addition to this, it appears that Jira Cloud documentation has already acknowledge that 'boosting a term' using a caret \^ does nothing anymore and is unsupported, see [https://support.atlassian.com/jira-core-cloud/docs/search-syntax-for-text-fields/].

In turn I suspect that Jira did once behave in this manner, but it does not appear to be doing so in any of the recent versions where we have documented this (at least as far back as Jira 7.3 we have this documented).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Try to follow the examples in [Boosting a term|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/search-syntax-for-text-fields-939938747.html#Searchsyntaxfortextfields-Boostingaterm:^]

h3. Expected Results
I would expect that either the number of results will vary by boosting a term OR the order in which those results are returned would be in some way affected by boosting one term over another.

h3. Actual Results
There appears to be no difference whatsoever in the search results when boosting any term in a text field search in JQL (either advanced or basic JQL searching)

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Trying to boost a term using a caret per the search syntax documentation does not appear to work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira Data Center clustering features might be only partially enabled if there are [non-breaking spaces|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Non-breaking_space] in {{cluster.properties}}.

Using the tool {{hexdump}} it is possible to confirm these characters are present; look for the value {{c2 a0}}:
 !hexdump.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Place a {{cluster.properties}} file containing special characters such as a [Non-breaking space|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Non-breaking_space] in {{JIRA_LOCAL_HOME}}. Here's an example file: [^cluster.properties-with-non-breaking-spaces.txt].
# Restart Jira.

h3. Expected Results
Jira Data Center clustering features are enabled normally, including cache and index replication.

h3. Actual Results
{{JIRA_SHARED_HOME}} will be enabled and used, but cache and index replication won't:
{noformat:none|title=Startup logs}
    ___ File Paths ____________________________
    
         JIRA Home                                     : \\some_location\share\Automation\Jira_Dev\sharedhome
         JIRA Local Home                               : C:\Program Files\Atlassian\Application Data\JIRA
         Location of atlassian-jira.log                : C:\Program Files\Atlassian\Application Data\JIRA\log\atlassian-jira.log

{noformat}
{code:xml|title=application.xml from a support zip}
<Clustering>OFF</Clustering>

    <location-of-entityengine.xml>file:/C:/Program%20Files/Atlassian/JIRA/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/entityengine.xml</location-of-entityengine.xml>
    <location-of-atlassian-jira.log>C:\Program Files\Atlassian\Application Data\JIRA\log\atlassian-jira.log</location-of-atlassian-jira.log>
    <location-of-indexes>C:\Program Files\Atlassian\Application Data\JIRA\caches\indexesV1</location-of-indexes>
    <location-of-attachments>\\bungie\share\Automation\Jira_Dev\sharedhome\data\attachments</location-of-attachments>
    <location-of-backups>\\some_location\share\Automation\Jira_Dev\sharedhome\export</location-of-backups>
  </path-information>
{noformat}
{code:none|title=Health checks}
Name: Cluster Index Replication
Is healthy: true
Failure reason: The Jira instance is not clustered.
Severity: UNDEFINED

Name: Cluster Locks
Is healthy: true
Failure reason: The Jira instance is not clustered.
Severity: UNDEFINED

Name: Cluster Scheduler
Is healthy: true
Failure reason: The Jira instance is not clustered.
Severity: UNDEFINED

Name: Cluster Cache Replication
Is healthy: true
Failure reason: The Jira instance is not clustered.
Severity: UNDEFINED

Name: Cluster Time Synchronisation
Is healthy: true
Failure reason: The Jira instance is not clustered.

h3. Workaround
Remove all [non-breaking spaces|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Non-breaking_space] from {{cluster.properties}} and restart Jira.
